headline: Ruben Amorim favourite has new Man United challenge after Michael Carrick decision
body: Former Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim(Image: Molly Darlington/Getty Images)

Michael Carrick has only been in the building a couple of weeks but already he has built up a good chunk of credit in the bank thanks to the opening two results as Manchester United interim head coach. After the draws to Leeds and Burnley, coupled with the defeat to Brighton, the next two fixtures looked daunting.

Manchester City and Arsenal are both battling it out for the Premier League title and have, for much of this season, looked considerably better than the Reds. But what a difference a new head coach can make as the form book was cast out of the window.
Pep Guardiola's City were made to look ordinary by United and even with their injury concerns, that is no small feat.
But perhaps more impressively, Carrick's men travelled to Arsenal on Sunday and managed to end their unbeaten home form this season and put a dent in their title charge too.

While the Reds continue to pick up results, no player can knock on the interim head coach's door and demand more game time. Carrick has introduced a 4-2-3-1 system which largely suits the players at his disposal but has meant some now have different roles.
FOLLOW OUR MAN UNITED FACEBOOK PAGE! Latest news and analysis via the MEN’s Manchester United Facebook page

For instance, Bruno Fernandes has been reintroduced to the attacking midfield role in the 4-2-3-1, which was an obvious decision to make. Under Ruben Amorim, the Portuguese captain was dropped deeper to allow both Matheus Cunha and Bryan Mbeumo to play as No.10s.

This pushed Kobbie Mainoo out to the peripheries of the United squad and even led him to request a loan move in the summer as he foresaw his minutes being cut. Now Mainoo has been welcomed back into the fold as a holding midfielder and one of Amorim's favourites is now having to deal with a fresh challenge to his position.

Mason Mount's time at United has been plagued by injuries but it felt like he was starting a renaissance at Old Trafford under Amorim. Between November and Christmas, Mount became integral as he benefitted from Africa Cup of Nations (AFCON) call-ups and the use of two No.10s in Amorim's system.
He scored two goals in this period, including the winner against Crystal Palace. But after picking up his knock on Boxing Day, Mount has since found his minutes cut again.
Mason Mount and Bruno Fernandes embrace after the former scored against Crystal Palace
In three Premier League matches since Amorim left, he has not started and played a total of 30 minutes from the bench. Against Arsenal, he was an unused substitute.

Like Mainoo discovered, Fernandes is undroppable in this team and while Mbeumo can be adapted to the centre-forward role, Mount knows he is battling with the Portuguese for that spot in the starting XI. He is not alone though, Cunha has also found starts hard to come by.

However, he has been called upon more often by Carrick and in the two opening matches of the interim head coach's era, he has secured an assist against City and a winner vs Arsenal. If Carrick wants to freshen things up and change the direction of the game, it is Cunha who will be called upon before Mount so patience will be key for the former Chelsea man.

Mount will take solace from the fact it remains early days and he will still be part of the plans, even if his minutes diminish somewhat. But for now, one of Amorim's favourites is having to make do with a spot on the bench.

headline: Patrick Dorgu injury latest as Manchester United face potential blow
body: Patrick Dorgu pulled up against Arsenal(Image: PA)

Patrick Dorgu could be ruled out with a hamstring injury after being substituted against Arsenal last weekend. Dorgu scored a superb goal in Manchester United's win at the Emirates, but was replaced with nine minutes remaining after going down with an injury.

Michael Carrick suggested Dorgu was brought off with cramp, but the 21-year-old appeared to hold his hamstring when he went down, and subsequently limped away from the stadium. When asked how the injury was as he departed, Dorgu responded: "We'll see."
Dorgu's injury is being assessed and United sources have insisted no timescale for his lay-off is clear at this stage, despite reports claiming he could be sidelined for around 10 weeks.
FOLLOW OUR MAN UNITED FB PAGE! Latest news and analysis via the MEN’s Manchester United Facebook page
Dorgu played on the right wing against Newcastle on Boxing Day and scored the matchwinner. He built on that performance by scoring against Manchester City from the wing again.
The Denmark international retained his starting role to face Arsenal at the Emirates, and he scored a stunning half-volley to fire United into a 2-1 lead in the second half of the game.

Speaking after Arsenal, Carrick said: “Pat’s been a big player for us, obviously he’s scored two goals but in terms of the threat and athleticism and quality, he’s been immense down the side with Luke [Shaw] against two teams that ask a lot of questions.

“I am delighted for him because the two goals he’s scored are very different goals. It's nice to see him smiling and happy. He obviously came off with, hopefully, a little bit of cramp, hopefully, it's nothing worse.
“At this stage, it's hard to tell, so we'll just have to wait and see. Hopefully it's not too bad.”

The MEN revealed this week that Dorgu "does loads of extras" in training, with a source crediting him for working "really hard". It's understood there has been a focus on improving Dorgu's crossing, with an emphasis on him perfecting his technique during training at Carrington.

United believe Dorgu's hard work is paying off. The defender knew an opportunity to regain his starting role would emerge during the Africa Cup of Nations, and he's contributed three goals and two assists in seven games, representing his hottest run of form since his arrival from Lecce.

headline: Man United transfer news LIVE - Cole Palmer stance, Vitor Roque eyed, Marcus Rashford battle
body: Hello and welcome to the MEN's Manchester United live blog on Wednesday, January 28.

The feel-good factor is well and truly back at Old Trafford after back-to-back wins against Manchester City and Arsenal. Matheus Cunha's superb winner lifted Michael Carrick's men into the Premier League top four places.

United are next in action on Sunday when they take on Fulham. Until then, attention returns to the January transfer window. The window closes next Monday and there could be a number of twists still to play out.

Liam Rosenior has warned that Cole Palmer is untouchable at Chelsea despite fears he is open to joining Manchester United. It was claimed earlier this week that Palmer would consider a move to Old Trafford as he feels unsettled in London.
FOLLOW OUR MAN UNITED FB PAGE! Latest news and analysis via the MEN’s Manchester United Facebook page
With that being said, we will bring you all the latest news throughout the day...
Manchester United are reportedly 'unconvinced' about loaning Joshua Zirkzee out only to welcome him back in the summer.
The forward has long been linked with a move away from Old Trafford this month, with AS Roma emerging as the most likely destination.
However, according to Italian publication Corriere dello Sport, United don’t want a simple loan and it remains to be seen what steps the Serie A side will take next.
Manchester United are reportedly one of three Premier League clubs keeping an eye on Brazilian striker Vitor Roque.
According to Radio Tupi, United, along with Chelsea and Tottenham, are keeping tabs on the forward, who Palmeiras have slapped a huge £43m asking price on.

The 20-year-old striker impressed at Cruzeiro and Athletico Paranaense earlier on in his career, scoring plenty of goals in Brazil's top-flight, which saw Barcelona come calling. However, the Brazilian striker struggled to make his mark in Spain.
He's scored just twice in 16 appearances before a loan move to Real Betis.
Just a recap in case you might have missed it last night, but Chelsea boss Liam Rosenior has warned that Cole Palmer is untouchable at Chelsea despite fears he is open to joining Manchester United.
It was claimed earlier this week that Palmer would consider a move to Old Trafford, as he feels unsettled in London.
But Rosenior said: “Is he untouchable, is he happy? Yes and yes. It’s simple, Cole Palmer is an incredible player like many players in the group.
“Cole is here, he’s very happy and I can’t wait to see him back on the pitch. Cole is very happy. I’ve had numerous conversations with him.
“Our thoughts are on how we can make this team better, how he can improve and how I can help him. He loves being here and he wants to be a Chelsea player.”

Manchester United have been handed a blow to their hopes of signing a Barcelona midfielder, which could affect the future of Marcus Rashford. United loaned out Rashford to the La Liga giants last summer for the season, with the England international impressing during his time in Spain.
Rashford expressed a desire to leave United during pre-season last summer, and subsequently signed for Barcelona on loan with his future at Old Trafford still uncertain.
Since signing for Barca, Rashford has scored eight goals and provided 12 assists for the La Liga giants, and has been tipped to make the move permanent at the end of the season.
Read more here
Manchester United captain Bruno Fernandes may be able to play a role in the club's proposed pursuit of former Wolves midfielder Ruben Neves.

The 28-year-old is currently playing in Saudi Arabia following a move to Al-Hilal in the summer of 2023. However, with Neves' deal expiring in the summer, he's believed to have interested parties prepared to secure his return to Europe before the end of the 2025/2026 season.

As a result, Al-Hilal are reportedly resigned to losing the Portuguese international - with £18million said to be enough to sign him in January. United are among those mentioned, with the Reds seeking to strengthen their midfield options.
Read more here

Since arriving at Chelsea, Cole Palmer hasn't hidden his allegiance to the club he idolised growing up. After netting a hat-trick against United at Stamford Bridge in April 2024, Palmer was put on the spot about his boyhood loyalties following the 4-3 victory.
"I just try and take each game as it comes and show the Chelsea fans and everyone what I came here to do, and that is just play football."

Later that year, Palmer reaffirmed his connection to United while discussing his childhood hero. Speaking to talkSPORT, he said: "Wayne Rooney. I was a United fan when I was younger, and I used to watch him all the time."

Chelsea boss Liam Rosenior has moved to dismiss speculation connecting Cole Palmer with what he describes as an 'unrealistic' transfer to Manchester United. The new Chelsea head coach maintains that Palmer is 'untouchable' and will not be departing Stamford Bridge in the foreseeable future.
He said: "It's simple: Cole's an incredible player like [Moises Caicedo] sitting next to me and many players in the group. I'm not surprised at the timing (of the rumours).
"A new manager comes in and all of a sudden there's people are (looking to) unsettle. It's not true. Cole's here, he's very happy and I can't wait to see him on the pitch.
"There's no reason for an assurance (from Chelsea's directors). It's so unrealistic. It's come from nowhere, there's nothing in it. There's no reason to have the conversation, that's where I'm at.

"Cole is very happy. We've had numerous conversations with him on how we can make this team better, how he can improve and how I can help him - because he loves being here and he wants to be a Chelsea player.
"You can't stop speculation, but some speculation is so far from the truth, there's not point having any discussion about it."
Manchester United face paying £26million (€30m) to sign Stade Rennais striker Mohamed Kader Meite in the January transfer window, according to reports in France.

Meite, 18, has rapidly become one of Europe's most wanted talents after his emergence in Ligue 1. The striker has scored three goals in 19 appearances in all competitions this season after previously bagging 14 in 32 games at youth level.

French outlet Quest-France have reported that United have registered an interest in the teenager. It comes after Foot Mercato suggested that United are preparing to ambush Al-Hilal's move to sign the France Under-21 international.
Read more here

A Manchester return could be on the horizon for Wythenshawe-born Palmer in a transfer few would have anticipated. The Sun has reported Palmer is "open" to joining United nearly three years after his remarkable £42.5m departure from Manchester City.

It's widely recognised that Palmer grew up supporting United and regularly attended matches at Old Trafford. Nevertheless, he could experience a vastly different Old Trafford atmosphere should his next visit come as a home player.
Read more here
Manchester United goalkeeper Andre Onana is reportedly in talks to secure a permanent transfer away from Old Trafford next summer.
The Cameroon international is currently on loan with Turkish club Trabzonspor and has impressed in the Turkish Super Lig, losing just three of the 16 games he's featured in.

They currently sit in third place behind Galatasaray and Fenerbahce, with Onana playing a key role since joining the club. United sanctioned the loan move following Senne Lammens' arrival at Old Trafford, which pushed the former Inter Milan shot stopper down the pecking order.
Read more here
Chelsea head coach Liam Rosenior has insisted that Cole Palmer is "very happy" to be at Stamford Bridge amid rumours linking him with a move to Manchester United.
He said: "I've had numerous conversations with Cole and he seems very happy to be here. He's a huge part in our long-term plans.
"My job and the club's job is to get him into a situation where he can consistently perform to the level he wants to. There was frustration in the Brentford game.
"We need to look after him and that's why I didn't involve him in the last game."

Former Manchester United midfielder Scott McTominay has expressed his satisfaction at the transformation at Old Trafford under Michael Carrick's stewardship - and he confesses it comes as little shock.

The ex-midfielder served as first-team coach at United during McTominay's time at the club. He has since assumed the role of head coach through to the season's conclusion, with his opening two matches in charge restoring optimism at the club.
A 2-0 triumph over local rivals Manchester City was accompanied by a 3-2 away success against league leaders Arsenal on Sunday.
Discussing United at a Napoli press conference, McTominay said: "Michael Carrick is such a great guy. I've got so much love and respect for him.
"Those two results vs Man City and Arsenal have been amazing, especially for me to watch. So I'm very, very proud of all the players and long may it continue."
You can read more here.
The Daily Mail claims Andre Onana is in talks to secure a permanent move away from Manchester United and return to former club Inter Milan.
The Cameroon goalkeeper's representatives are said to be in Milan this week to discuss a possible return to his former club, with his current loan at Trabzonspor set to expire this summer.
As things stand, Onana is set to return to Old Trafford, but has fallen down the pecking order and struggled with form since his £47.2million move from the San Siro.
Although Onana has not given up hope of resurrecting his United career, a return to Italy is said to be something under consideration.

Manchester United has launched its latest collaboration with the Stone Roses. On Tuesday, the club unveiled a range of shirts, jackets and shorts as part of its new adidas x Man United x The Stone Roses collection.

The centrepiece of the collection is the Man United x The Stone Roses Shirt (£90). This features an all-over graphic print of the band’s signature paint splatter artwork from the ‘I Wanna Be Adored’ single, designed by guitarist John Squire.
It also features a unique Man United crest with Stone Roses lemon graphics and ‘I Wanna Be Adored’ text inside. Also available is the Man United x The Stone Roses Long Sleeve Shirt (£140).
You can read more here.

January is a notoriously difficult month in which to strike up transfer business and, as things stand, things look like being quiet at Old Trafford when it comes to incomings. Should there be any movement, though, there are a few decent shirt numbers up for grabs for potential signings;

Cole Palmer to United is the exciting whisper doing the rounds right now. Time will tell if anything comes of that, while his current club Chelsea are naturally down-playing any potential exit. After two wins from two under Michael Carrick on the pitch, this is also really getting fans talking on social media, too, as fanciful as any deal might be at this stage.
Check out the latest on Palmer here >>>

A return move to United has been mooted - and hoped for - for a while. But will it ever happen? The former United midfielder was asked about all-things Old Trafford and has responded with some kind words indeed for Michael Carrick. Here's what Scott McTominay had to say;

Michael Carrick is such a great guy. I've got so much love and respect for him. The two results vs Man City and Arsenal have been amazing, especially for me to watch. I'm very, very proud of all the players and long may it continue.
Away from the first-team, there's some lunchtime action for United's next generation. One or two familiar names in the mix, not least a certain Kai Rooney on the bench;

Former Manchester United manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer was tipped for an Old Trafford comeback as interim manager, only to miss out to Michael Carrick. Now, as Carrick celebrates back-to-back wins, Solskjaer faces a different challenge entirely.

United's managerial choice has already paid dividends, with Carrick securing Premier League victories over Manchester City and Arsenal. Solskjaer has remained unemployed since departing Besiktas earlier this campaign but will be monitoring one of his former club's Premier League rivals very closely this week.

The Norwegian is a UEFA technical observer for the Champions League this season, one of more than 20 footballing figures to hold the responsibility. His role will bring him back to England this week, with Solskjaer set to attend Liverpool's home fixture against Qarabag in a professional capacity.
You can read more here.

Manchester United could reportedly be set to shell out £26million (€30m) to secure the signature of Stade Rennais striker Mohamed Kader Meite in the January transfer window, according to French media reports.

At just 18 years old, Meite has quickly become one of the most sought-after talents in European football following his breakout season in Ligue 1. The young forward has netted three goals in 19 appearances across all competitions this term, building on a record of 14 goals in 32 matches at youth level.

French publication Quest-France has reported that United have shown interest in the teenage sensation. This news follows earlier reports from Foot Mercato suggesting that United are planning to thwart Al-Hilal's bid to sign the France Under-21 international.
While reports are linking Joshua Zirkzee with a move away from Old Trafford this month, TuttoSport claim United have made it clear they won't be selling the Dutch international this month.
AS Roma have already been knocked back in their quest to sign the 24-year-old and now Juventus look set to suffer the same fate.

Juve are reportedly growing desperate in their hunt for a new striker, with Dusan Vlahovic out injured. The Old Lady had been keen on a move for Jean Philippe Mateta, but Nottingham Forest look to be in pole position.
The Italian club saw a move for Fenerbahce’s Youssef En-Nesyri collapse and attention has turned to Zirkzee.
However, United are said to have made it clear he won't be leaving the club this month.
Paris Saint-Germain are reportedly preparing to battle with Barcelona to sign Marcus Rashford in the summer.

According to Football Insider, PSG are ready to jump at the opportunity to bring the forward to Paris if Barcelona hesistate. Luis Enrique's men want to bring him to the club as part of a significant change to their forward line.
Unfortunately, Patrick Dorgu could be ruled out with a hamstring injury after being substituted against Arsenal last weekend

Michael Carrick suggested Dorgu was brought off with cramp, but the 21-year-old appeared to hold his hamstring when he went down, and subsequently limped away from the stadium. When asked how the injury was as he departed, Dorgu responded: "We'll see."
Dorgu's injury is being assessed and United sources have insisted no timescale for his lay-off is clear at this stage, despite reports claiming he could be sidelined for around 10 weeks.
Teamtalk have reported that Premier League duo Crystal Palace and Tottenham are interested in signing Joshua Zirkzee from Man United this window.
The report states that his representatives are hopeful that a deal can be completed before February.
Juventus have added Joshua Zirkzee to their January transfer shortlist, according to the Daily Mail.
The Serie A side are keen to sign a new attacker and recently had a request to sign Randal Kolo Muani on loan rebuffed. Zirkzee has now emerged as a potential alternative.
Cole Palmer would supposedly be open to a move to Manchester United in the summer, according to reports.

The Sun have reported that the 23-year-old would be keen on returning to Manchester, should United show any desire to bring him to Old Trafford. It's said that Palmer, who is contracted until 2033, misses his hometown of Wythenshawe.
Talks between Manchester United and Galatasaray will commence today regarding Manuel Ugarte, according to Turkish journalist Suleyman Rodop.

The Super Lig side want to loan the midfielder until the end of the season, with an option to purchase. “Galatasaray’s critical meeting on the transfer will be tomorrow. Galatasaray and Ugarte (the player’s camp) sit down at the table tomorrow and the expected meeting will take place," he said.
"If Manchester United accepts a purchase option on Ugarte and loans him, they will complete the transfer."
Paul Scholes believes Michael Carrick would suit one of Man United's rivals after insisting the club won't make his stay a permanent one at the end of the season.

Despite beating Manchester City and Arsenal, speculation has fuelled suggestions that he could become the permanent head coach. After claiming United will be 'scarred' by their previous experience of giving Ole Gunnar Solskjaer the job on the back of an interim spell, Scholes then suggested he could return to Tottenham.
"It could be like a Tottenham manager from this [for Carrick]. It wouldn't surprise me," he said.
TEAMtalk have reported that Man United are stepping up their interest to sign Adam Wharton from Crystal Palace this summer.

The report states that United want to make the 21-year-old their marquee signing over rivals Liverpool. Manchester City and Newcastle United are also keen after holding preliminary discussions with his entourage.

headline: Three ways Man United could line up without 'big player' Patrick Dorgu
body: Patrick Dorgu could be out for an extended period through injury(Image: Alex Pantling/Getty Images)

Manchester United supporters are currently waiting anxiously to discover if Patrick Dorgu's injury is serious or not ahead of the clash with Fulham on Sunday. The Dane has been a revelation for Michael Carrick having been moved up field in the 4-2-3-1 formation favoured by the interim head coach.

“Pat’s been a big player for us, obviously he’s scored two goals but in terms of the threat and athleticism and quality, he’s been immense," declared Carrick after Dorgu had put Arsenal to the sword on Sunday. In Carrick's first two matches in charge, Dorgu has scored in both including a screamer at the Emirates and the goal that sealed victory over City.

However, before Matheus Cunha's winner, Dorgu was substituted with what appeared to be a hamstring injury. Immediately after the game, Carrick suggested the injury was merely cramp and he would be assessed.

On Tuesday, reports suggested Dorgu would be out for ten weeks with a hamstring concern. It is understood by MEN Sport that Dorgu is still being assessed and no timeline for his injury has yet been confirmed. But should he be out for one game or an extended period, United will need to replace him.
So with this in mind, we have taken a look at three ways United could choose to line up without Dorgu for however long he is out for.
FOLLOW OUR MAN UNITED FB PAGE! Latest news and analysis via the MEN’s Manchester United Facebook page

The first choice for United and probably the most likely option would be to recall Cunha to the starting XI. Carrick has been using the Brazilian as his first choice substitution in recent matches and he has been repaying that faith.

His goal cutting in from the left flank on Sunday was a stroke of genius and will have stood him in good stead to get a start against Fulham at the weekend if Dorgu is injured. Cunha's involvement would weaken the bench but that is a price United will more than likely have to pay.
Manchester United XI with Matheus Cunha replacing Patrick Dorgu
Another option available to Carrick would be to recall Mason Mount to the starting XI. This would be an unorthodox move for the Reds considering Mount is more of an attacking midfielder.

However, the former Chelsea man has experience playing across the attacking midfield three and may need to show greater flexibility if he is to get more minutes in the starting line-up. Now Bruno Fernandes has been moved back to attacking midfield, Mount will find it difficult to unseat him - just as Kobbie Mainoo did.
Therefore, playing him on the left could be an opportunity for him to stake his claim again.
Manchester United XI with Mason Mount replacing Patrick Dorgu

United are not blessed with many left wingers but even so, this seems an unlikely wildcard option. Teenager Shea Lacey is more suited to playing on the right but has featured on the left flank previously in emergencies.

The 18-year-old was sent off for a quick second yellow offence in his last appearance for United but he need not worry about that affecting his chances in the first team. Carrick has made it his mission to show support for the academy players and recently attended their FA Youth Cup fixture vs Derby County.
That being said, thrusting Lacey into a position he is not fully comfortable with while Dorgu is out would be a major curveball.
Manchester United XI with Shea Lacey replacing Patrick Dorgu

headline: Cole Palmer to Man United transfer rumours see Liam Rosenior break his silence
body: Chelsea star Cole Palmer has been linked with a shock move to Manchester United(Image: Getty Images)

Chelsea boss Liam Rosenior has moved to dismiss speculation connecting Cole Palmer with what he describes as an 'unrealistic' transfer to Manchester United. The new Chelsea head coach maintains that Palmer is 'untouchable' and will not be departing Stamford Bridge in the foreseeable future.

The midfielder signed a seven-year contract with the Blues in September 2023, including a club option for an additional year. Shortly after departing his native Wythenshawe in south Manchester for west London, Palmer received his first call-up to the England squad, having established himself as a Premier League star at Chelsea.

But reports emerged on Monday suggesting that Palmer, a boyhood United supporter, would be receptive to a return to Manchester and a switch to United, despite their current difficulties. The 23-year-old was said to be willing to entertain approaches from Old Trafford, having allegedly grown unsettled in London, where he has spent the last two and a half years following his £42.5million departure from Manchester City.

However, Rosenior delivered a forthright response before Chelsea's Champions League fixture away to Napoli on Wednesday. When questioned whether Palmer was 'untouchable' and 'happy', Rosenior answered: "Yes and yes.
"It's simple: Cole's an incredible player like [Moises Caicedo] sitting next to me and many players in the group. I'm not surprised at the timing (of the rumours).
FOLLOW OUR MAN UNITED FB PAGE! Latest news and analysis via the MEN’s Manchester United Facebook page
"A new manager comes in and all of a sudden there's people are (looking to) unsettle. It's not true. Cole's here, he's very happy and I can't wait to see him on the pitch.
"There's no reason for an assurance (from Chelsea's directors). It's so unrealistic. It's come from nowhere, there's nothing in it. There's no reason to have the conversation, that's where I'm at.
Liam Rosenior has had his say on Cole Palmer to Man United rumours (Image: Jasper Wax)

"Cole is very happy. We've had numerous conversations with him on how we can make this team better, how he can improve and how I can help him - because he loves being here and he wants to be a Chelsea player.
"You can't stop speculation, but some speculation is so far from the truth, there's not point having any discussion about it."

Prior to their 3-1 victory over Crystal Palace on Sunday, Rosenior said: "I've had numerous conversations with Cole and he seems very happy to be here, he is very happy to be here. He's a huge part of our plans in the long term.
"He's an outstanding player. Every player goes through difficult moments in their career in terms of injury.
"It's not any reflection of his quality."

headline: Man United can repeat transfer trick to sign Cole Palmer from Chelsea
body: Cole Palmer is being linked with a move to United(Image: Photo by Shaun Botterill/Getty Images)
Chelsea star Cole Palmer is linked with a sensational move to Manchester United and there's one transfer from 2014 that could provide United fans with hope of a move materialising.

It is well-documented that Palmer is a childhood United fan - something which could prove incredibly important down the line if a move begins to formulate. Reports have emerged in recent days that the England international is considering his future at Stamford Bridge and despite his recent injury and subsequent struggle for form, Palmer remains one of the Premier League's finest players.
"I just try and take each game as it comes and show the Chelsea fans and everyone what I came here to do, and that is just play football."
FOLLOW OUR MAN UNITED FB PAGE!** Latest news and analysis via the MEN’s Manchester United Facebook page**

Now, 12 years ago, there was another United fan playing for Chelsea - Spaniard Juan Mata. The classy midfielder won the World Cup with Spain in 2010 and after impressing at Valencia with the likes of David Villa and David Silva, he earned a move to the Premier League with Chelsea.

Despite winning the Player of the Year in his first two seasons, he didn't hold down his place in the third campaign and despite being okay with staying at the club, when United came calling he couldn't turn them down.
It was Juan Mata's dream to move to United(Image: Photo by Alex Livesey/Getty Images)

"The summer before, there was some interest [from United],” the then-31-year-old said during his appearance in a previous episode of the UTD Podcast. "No [I wouldn’t leave then]. I wanted to see what the challenge was and there was never really anything else other than interest. There was not an offer, so I didn’t have the real opportunity."

He continued: "When Manchester United called and they said ‘We’re going to go for you and make an offer to Chelsea, we want you to come’, I spoke with them. I really wanted to go and really wanted to feel what it is to be a Manchester United player."I had suffered playing against United with Chelsea and they are definitely one of the biggest clubs in the world. At that moment, they were struggling with the first season of [David] Moyes and were not doing great in the league, but that doesn’t matter. I wanted to come to be a player for this club."
When he left the club in 2022, he would post on social media: "Sometimes reality exceeds dreams. Thank you, Manchester United."
United would've known Mata was a big fan of the club from when negotiations began, so the lure of joining his dream club would've made the process a lot smoother.

Now, with Palmer, United could look to exploit the same loyalties and get Palmer on board at the club. The Sun are reporting that Palmer is unhappy in London and a return to his homeland may be on the cards, although a return to City is not happening.

At 23, Palmer is the type of player that United could build their team around. He's a catalyst in the number 10 role and the heartbeat of the Chelsea team when playing. Should Bruno Fernandes leave the club in the summer, then Palmer would be an ideal candidate to lead the team forward in years to come.
Palmer training ahead of Chelsea v Napoli(Image: Photo by Adrian Dennis / AFP via Getty Images)
Speaking ahead of Chelsea v Napoli in the Champions League on Wednesday, Chelsea boss Liam Rosenior again addressed the rumours linking Palmer to United.

Asked if Palmer was "untouchable" and "happy", he said: "Yes and yes. It's simple: Cole's an incredible player like [Moises Caicedo] sitting next to me and many players in the group. I'm not surprised at the timing (of the rumours).

"A new manager comes in and all of a sudden there's people are (looking to) unsettle. It's not true. Cole's here, he's very happy and I can't wait to see him on the pitch. There's no reason for an assurance (from Chelsea's directors). It's so unrealistic. It's come from nowhere, there's nothing in it. There's no reason to have the conversation, that's where I'm at.

"Cole is very happy. We've had numerous conversations with him on how we can make this team better, how he can improve and how I can help him - because he loves being here and he wants to be a Chelsea player. You can't stop speculation, but some speculation is so far from the truth, there's not point having any discussion about it."

headline: Rasmus Hojlund driving people at Man United 'crazy' as sacked manager dubbed 'reckless'
body: Rasmus Hojlund has scored nine goals during his loan spell at Napoli(Image: Marco Mantovani/Getty Images)

Rasmus Hojlund is thriving while on loan at Napoli from Manchester United, and has already been praised for his performances in Italy. Hojlund left United last summer to join the reigning Serie A champions on a season-long loan, which also included the option to make the move permanent.
Napoli have the option of signing Hojlund at the end of the season for £43.5million (€50million), which would become an obligation to buy if the Italian club were to qualify for the Champions League.
Since moving to Naples, Hojlund has scored nine goals across all competitions for Antonio Conte’s side and has been widely praised for his performances by his manager, as well as several pundits.
This comes after Hojlund managed 10 goals for United in his second season at Old Trafford following his £72million switch from Atalanta back in 2023.

United signed Hojlund in the summer of 2023 after Erik ten Hag’s first season at Old Trafford, and went on to link up with former Reds midfielder Scott McTominay at Napoli after completing his loan move.
FOLLOW OUR MAN UNITED FB PAGE! Latest news and analysis via the MEN’s Manchester United Facebook page
McTominay also left United to join Napoli, but did so on a permanent deal back in 2024 when Ten Hag was still the club’s manager at the time.
Former Premier League star Gianfranco Zola has previously given a clear verdict about Hojlund’s time at Napoli and what United’s view on the deal might be.
"Hojlund is driving everyone crazy, even people at Manchester United," Zola said in an interview with Gazzetta dello Sport last month.
"After McTominay left because of [Erik] ten Hag's reckless decisions, they let go of a striker like that."
United made several changes to their forward line during the summer transfer window, with Hojlund’s exit one of several deals that were completed.
With Hojlund leaving the club, United went on to sign Benjamin Sesko, Bryan Mbeumo and Matheus Cunha to revamp their forward options in one window.

It remains to be seen what the future holds for Hojlund, with Napoli sporting director Giovanni Manna recently explaining the terms of the deal and why he expects the United loanee to sign on a permanent basis in the summer.
"We did everything we could to sign him. There were more storied clubs interested, but his will was crucial, and we are proud of it," Manna told Corriere dello Sport last month.
"We had no doubts. Rasmus is decisive in terms of numbers, but also in how he understands the coach's input. This makes a difference.
"There's an option to buy and an obligation to buy if we qualify for the Champions League. The player considers himself a Napoli player, and the same goes for us. This is extremely important."
Manna was also about whether a permanent move for Hojlund was likely, to which he replied: "As of today, I think so."

headline: Marcus Rashford shows his true colours with reaction to Aston Villa transfer
body: Marcus Rashford has wished Tammy Abraham well(Image: Thomas Eisenhuth - UEFA, UEFA via Getty Images)

Marcus Rashford has told Tammy Abraham to: "Go smash it," with Aston Villa as the English striker makes his return to the Premier League. The Villans tied down the 28-year-old on a four-and-a-half year deal on Tuesday, paying Besiktas £18.25million for the pleasure.
Among the names who were quick to welcome Abraham back to the Premier League was Rashford, who took to Instagram to write: "Congrats, Tammy! Go smash it bro," as he was unveiled at Villa Park.

No stranger to the midlands, it comes as Rashford enjoyed a half-season loan with Villa at the end of 2024/25, flourishing under Unai Emery's tutelage and racking up four goals and six assists from 17 appearances. While the club had the option to make his move permanent over the summer, a deal ultimately failed to come to fruition, as Rashford returned to Old Trafford.

After realising he had no part to play in Ruben Amorim's plans, the 28-year-old assessed his options before securing a season-long loan with Barcelona. Like Villa's previous clause, the La Liga giants also have the option to make his move to the Camp Nou permanent this summer for around £30m.

Given Rashford has thrived under Hansi Flick this term, it's a possibility which grows realer and realer by the day. To date, Rashford has managed three goals and eight assists from 20 outings in La Liga alone, despite stiff competition for places in the form of Lamine Yamal and Raphinha.
FOLLOW OUR MAN UNITED FB PAGE! Latest news and analysis via the MEN’s Manchester United Facebook page

However, with Amorim no longer a part of Manchester United and Michael Carrick taking the reins until season's end on an interim basis, there has been speculation that the Englishman could return to Old Trafford and revitalise his career this summer.

It's been a slow month for the Reds in terms of incomings and outgoings, with Carrick seemingly investing his time and energy to securing the best possible Premier League finish with his current crop, rather than dipping into the January transfer window.

However, that hasn't prevented the rumour mill from churning with regards to a summer shortlist - with the centre of midfield taking the brunt. Casemiro will leave United at the end of the season, which could leave United scrambling for a long-term replacement to the Brazilian powerhouse.

As a result, the club has been linked with a wealth of talent, from Brighton's Carlos Baleba to Nottingham Forest's Elliot Anderson. While the club has also seen rumours of a shock move for Chelsea's Cole Palmer, with suggestions floating around that the Wythenshawe-born talent is unsettled and homesick in the capital, Liam Rosenior has worked to quash any speculation of an exit.

Speaking at a press conference on Tuesday evening looking to Chelsea's clash with Napoli in the Champions League, the head coach said: "It's simple: Cole's an incredible player like [Moises Caicedo] sitting next to me and many players in the group.
Tammy Abraham has signed for Aston Villa(Image: Neville Williams, Aston Villa FC via Getty Images)

"I'm not surprised at the timing (of the rumours). A new manager comes in and all of a sudden there's people are (looking to) unsettle. It's not true. Cole's here, he's very happy and I can't wait to see him on the pitch.
"There's no reason for an assurance (from Chelsea's directors). It's so unrealistic. It's come from nowhere, there's nothing in it. There's no reason to have the conversation, that's where I'm at.

"Cole is very happy. We've had numerous conversations with him on how we can make this team better, how he can improve and how I can help him - because he loves being here and he wants to be a Chelsea player.
"You can't stop speculation, but some speculation is so far from the truth, there's not point having any discussion about it."

headline: New Harry Maguire vs Gabriel footage shows Arsenal man's shocking response to Man United star
body: Harry Maguire and Gabriel were spotted in a verbal altercation(Image: Alex Pantling, Getty Images)

Newly released footage reveals Arsenal's Gabriel Magalhaes declining to shake hands with Harry Maguire following Manchester United's victory on Sunday. United clinched a thrilling 3-2 win at the Emirates Stadium, thanks to Matheus Cunha's decisive goal in the 87th minute.

After a gripping encounter, it meant that United secured all three points, dealing a blow to Arsenal's Premier League title aspirations. Toward the end of the match, a clash between Maguire and Gabriel resulted in the Arsenal defender ending up on the ground.

The tension continued even after referee Craig Pawson signalled the end of the game. The footage, shared by Malaysian broadcaster Stadium Astro, shows Gabriel refusing to accept Maguire's offer of a handshake as a peace gesture.
Noussair Mazraoui is then seen observing the situation and approaching the pair. Mazraoui then pushes Gabriel, who was shouting at Maguire, causing further agitation.
Senne Lammens then steps in to restrain Gabriel, guiding him towards the tunnel. Maguire was then free to celebrate the dramatic win while Gabriel retreated to recover.
FOLLOW OUR MAN UNITED FB PAGE! Latest news and analysis via the MEN’s Manchester United Facebook page

"We spoke about it before the game, coming to the league leaders, who have been excellent this year, I must say, they ask a lot of questions of you, to come here and have the setback late on to get the winner, it was a magnificent performance."
Maguire's individual display earned him player of the match and plenty of plaudits, with England legend Gary Lineker describing the defender as "one of the most underrated players in football."

Speaking on The Rest Is Football, Lineker said: "I know people have a pop at him, even people in the game have a pop at him, and I know that he can be turned by a striker with pace, but he makes up for it to a degree with his intelligence.
Gabriel seemingly turned down a handshake from Harry Maguire(Image: Alex Pantling/Getty Images)
"He can play as well, he's good on the ball and he's never let England down when he's played for his country.
"I would also say he's bloody brilliant in both boxes from set-pieces. There is an obvious weakness with the slight lack of pack but he's got the experience to handle that."

headline: MARSHALL: Cunha has done everything right under Michael Carrick - now he needs Manchester United reward
body: Michael Carrick has handled Matheus Cunha superbly so far

The pent-up frustration and disappointment that Matheus Cunha felt at finding his place in the Manchester United team under threat for the first time came pouring out during his celebration at the Emirates. The Brazilian celebrated wildly with the away end before directing his anger down a camera lens.

It's been a strange week or so for the 26-year-old Brazilian, who has found himself on the bench for successive Premier League games for the first time since his move from Wolves in the summer, but has also managed to deliver two decisive moments.

Cunha came on for the final 19 minutes against Manchester City last week and produced a lively cameo. His clever runs offered an outlet to United and he created the goal with which Patrick Dorgu killed the game off.

That wasn't enough to get him back in the team at Arsenal. This time, he got the final 21 minutes and again looked up for the fight. His contribution was even bigger, striding forward and curling a stunning goal into the corner of David Raya's net to earn United a famous victory.
FOLLOW OUR MAN UNITED FACEBOOK PAGE! Latest news and analysis via the MEN’s Manchester United Facebook page

Cunha has taken his goal contributions to seven in 22 games with his efforts over the past week, and once again, it looks like his Old Trafford career is threatening to kick into gear. Despite being signed as a perfect fit for Ruben Amorim's 3-4-2-1 system, he only showed glimpses under the Portuguese head coach, and his best performances have come as a false nine.
Speaking after the win at the Emirates, Michael Carrick massaged Cunha's ego, showering him with praise for the contribution he has made despite not starting either of his first two games in charge.
"Matheus coming on, a big impact again like he did last week," said Carrick. "Creating a goal last week. I just fancied him to score when the ball came out of his feet.
"He kind of epitomises what we've been like this week. Matheus has not started both games, but he's had a real big impact. He's been disappointed not to start but he's used it in a really good way.
"Two huge moments and he totally deserves that winning goal for how he's applied himself, and I’m absolutely delighted."

Carrick has made a bold call with leaving the £62.5million signing out so far, especially for Dorgu. As well as the young Dane has done, on stature and squad status, the safe decision would have been to start the big-money summer signing.

These decisions are even harder for Carrick because of the lack of games to use his squad, which is now only missing Matthijs de Ligt and Joshua Zirkzee. In a normal season for United, Cunha could have started in Europe in midweek, but that isn't an option.

There are only 15 games left this season and by the time of the Fulham game this weekend, Cunha will have played a little over 40 minutes in three weeks. That makes the challenge not only of rotation but also of keeping players happy all the more difficult for Carrick.

So far, he has got it right with the Brazilian. Cunha has earned a start, although the problem is nobody deserves to be dropped either. Perhaps Dorgu's injury and the different game plan required to take on Fulham at Old Trafford will open a door.

It certainly feels like Carrick needs to give him that. If he has kept him on side so far and managed to get him to channel his disappointment in the right way, that can quickly change if positive impacts off the bench only lead to more time on the bench.

Cunha is doing the right things at Carrington. Like the rest of the squad, he has embraced the shorter, sharper sessions at Carrington and his form looks to be trending in the right direction again. He has done everything Carrick has asked of him in the past two weeks, and now it is time for that to be rewarded.

headline: MARSHALL: United player ratings vs Arsenal with one 9/10 and five 8/10s
body: Manchester United celebrate Matheus Cunha's goal against Arsenal
Manchester United continued their dream start under Michael Carrick as they secured back-to-back wins against the Premier League's top two with a famous victory at the Emirates Stadium.

It felt like United had weathered the early storm from Arsenal when the hosts took the lead. It was a sloppy goal to concede and Lisandro Martinez got the final touch as he battled Jurrien Timber in his six-yard box.
But United's response was excellent and they capitalised on an Arsenal defensive blunder to level. Martin Zubimendi's pass handed the chance to Bryan Mbeumo and he rounded David Raya to score.

Carrick's side then took the lead with a stunning goal early in the second half. Dorgu teed the chance up for himself with some clever control and unleashed a stunning volley that hit the bar and went in. Mikel Merino looked like he had secured a draw for Arsenal only for Matheus Cunha to score almost immediately.
Here's the MEN player ratings.
FOLLOW OUR MAN UNITED FACEBOOK PAGE! Latest news and analysis via the MEN’s Manchester United Facebook page
Senne Lammens: Good saves from Zubimendi and Saka and mostly dealt well with the aerial bombardment. Crowded out for the equaliser. 7
Diogo Dalot: Dealt well with Trossard and looks a little more comfortable at right-back. The kind of solid and unfussy game he has needed. 7
Harry Maguire: Surely worth a new contract if this form continues. Looked the best centre-back on the pitch, which really is saying something. 9
Lisandro Martinez: Should have been stronger against Timber for Arsenal's opening goal. One good block on Rice but Gyokeres troubled him. 7
Luke Shaw: Defended really well against Saka and stayed aware throughout. Arsenal used clever moment down that flank but Shaw was never exposed. 8
Casemiro: Big contribution in his own box from set-pieces and used the ball well. Another reminder that he can still cut it at the highest level. 7
Kobbie Mainoo: Felt that United got a foothold in the game when they got the ball to Mainoo more often. Growing in confidence under Carrick and got the late assist. 8
Amad: Took in-swinging corners and got his deliveries spot on. One poor choice on the break in the first half but kept at it. 6
Bruno Fernandes: Curious game. Sloppy with a couple of passes but also had moments where he looked really dangerous and led well when in front. 7
Patrick Dorgu: Weak defensive header in the build-up to the first goal but boy did he make amends. An incredible goal to put United ahead and maintain his own momentum. 8
Bryan Mbeumo: Now scored against Liverpool, City and Arsenal. Took his goal really well and was a threat with his movement and clever runs. 8
Substitutes
Matheus Cunha: Took up some good positions and again looked bright off the bench. Brilliant, brilliant goal. 8
Benjamin Sesko: Little time to make an impact. 7
Noussair Mazraoui: Late sub. 6
Subs not used: Bayindir, Yoro, Heaven, Malacia, Ugarte, Mount

headline: MARSHALL: What Michael Carrick did after Manchester United third goal vs Arsenal spoke volumes
body: Matheus Cunha celebrates scoring for Manchester United at Arsenal

Michael Carrick stood motionless on the Emirates touchline. Hands behind his smart black jacket, dressed to kill like a Manchester United manager should be. Inside, his stomach must have been churning.
He raised his left arm to try to wave his team forward, but his right arm never moved. He looked like the calmest man inside a stadium that had long since lost its head.

A couple of minutes earlier, Casemiro had grabbed the back of Matheus Cunha's shirt and slammed him into the turf in sheer delight. That wasn't even to celebrate the forward's stunning goal, but to mark him winning a free-kick from an Arsenal corner. The emotions were everywhere, from a United side finding its mojo again to an Arsenal team that just can't take control of this title race.
FOLLOW OUR MAN UNITED FACEBOOK PAGE! Latest news and analysis via the MEN’s Manchester United Facebook page
Everywhere apart from the away technical area, that is. United's coaches poured out to appeal for a late free-kick as they defended another Arsenal cross. The unflappable Carrick barely flinched.

When the full-time whistle blew, Carrick clenched his left fist and twice subtly punched the air next to him. There was a low-key embrace with his staff and a handshake with Mikel Arteta. For the 44-year-old Carrick, this is just what Manchester United do.

As auditions go, this couldn't have got off to a better start. Carrick has guided United to wins against the Premier League's top two when a month ago they had looked like a team devoid of confidence and lacking enjoyment. This win against Arsenal was the kind of dramatic away-day success the very best United teams produce.

They have had some moments to savour in the FA Cup here in recent years, but they hadn't won a league match at the Emirates since December 2017. That was the day of David de Gea's 14 saves and Jesse Lingard's double in a 3-1 victory under Jose Mourinho.

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer, Ralf Rangnick, Erik ten Hag and Ruben Amorim had tried and failed to win a league fixture here. Carrick had at least some experience of success. He was among Solskjaer's staff for an FA Cup fourth-round win on a Friday night in January seven years ago.

A lot had changed since then. Arsenal have gradually built to a point where their 22-year title drought could end in the next five months. United have cycled through a succession of failed managers and are back on another short-term appointment in Carrick. Short-term for now, at least.

The feelings of de ja vu are pretty hard to escape right now. Carrick has delivered exactly the kind of uplift Solskjaer brought in December 2018, both in mood and performance. He has to be in the frame to get the job permanently after these victories. Any more of this and it may prove impossible to overlook him.
This was a different kind of win, as well. They started the derby well last weekend and built the confidence that comes from seeing a game plan work on the pitch.

At the Emirates, they began on the back foot. They faced a flurry of early set-pieces and Senne Lammens turned over a header from Martin Zubimendi at point-blank range. Set-pieces had seemed Arsenal's likeliest route to goal, but it felt like United had weathered the storm when they went behind.

Patrick Dorgu failed to deal with Piero Hincapie's cross, Bukayo Saka found a pass to Martin Odegaard and his mis-hit shot was sliced into his own net by Lisandro Martinez. You feared for United at that point, but the response was exceptional before and after half-time.

Bruno Fernandes almost capitalised on a defensive error from William Saliba before Bryan Mbeumo punished Zubimendi. The Spaniard's pass back towards his goal only succeeded in playing in United's false nine and he rounded David Raya before finishing.

Arsenal had been shooting themselves in the foot, but they were powerless to stop the goal that gave United the lead. Dorgu manipulated a bouncing ball into a more promising position and then sent a 20-yard rocket fizzing past Raya, the ball hitting the underside of the bar and bouncing into the roof of the net to give the strike the kind of aesthetic it deserved.

Dorgu's renaissance over the last five weeks has been one of the stories of United's season. He had struggled in the first half here, not only with Arsenal's goal but against Saka, who got far more joy against him than he did the excellent Luke Shaw. But Dorgu's future surely belongs further forward if his recent contributions in the final third are anything to go by.

Arsenal piled the pressure on in search of an equaliser and looked to have rescued a point when Mikel Merino bundled a corner over the line, but United again responded almost immediately. Kobbie Mainoo poked a clever pass to Matheus Cunha, who bent a stunning shot from distance into the corner of the net.

As the majority of the Emirates emptied, United's players gathered in front of a delirious away end at full-time. Casemiro handed his shirt to a fan, and Carrick was serenaded several times. By the time Cunha and the immense Harry Maguire finished their TV interviews, it was still full. There was time for one final flurry of fist pumps after a breathtaking victory.

headline: Wayne Rooney praises Michael Carrick for something Ruben Amorim never did at Manchester United
body: Michael Carrick has supported the academy.(Image: 2026 Manchester United FC/Getty)

Wayne Rooney has praised Michael Carrick and his staff for attending Manchester United academy games. Rooney believes that support for the club's youth system had been "missing" before Carrick's return.
Carrick attended an Under-21 game at Leigh Sports Village last Tuesday and showed further support for the Under-18s at Old Trafford in the FA Youth Cup. He was joined by his staff and both occasions.
Ruben Amorim once walked over to observe some of an academy match at Carrington, but he did not make the effort to properly watch a youth game during his one-and-a-half-year tenure.

Rooney sat alongside Carrick in the directors' box at Old Trafford to watch the U18s because his son, Kai, made an appearance from the bench. And United's all-time top goalscorer believes it's important to have first-team representation at academy fixtures to show support to youngsters.
FOLLOW OUR MAN UNITED FB PAGE! Latest news and analysis via the MEN’s Manchester United Facebook page
Speaking to the BBC, Rooney said: "It is great to see all the coaches taking a big interest in the academy, which is important for that football club. I have a different focus watching my son.
"Potentially in the next few years, some of those players might get an opportunity for the first team, so it is important they have that interest. t was great to see them all.

"He [Kai] has upped the age group to play in the Youth Cup. He helped them get the win. It was a proud moment for me. Even on Saturday, they were all [first-team staff] at the Under-16 game as well before they travelled to London [to face Arsenal]. It has been missing. I have been quite vocal on this.

"It has been missing in the last few years. It is great to see that coming back into the club. When we had a Sunday game, after training, we used to finish training and go and watch the academy games.

"That was the norm. That is what I have known at Manchester United. With my two lads in the academy, I haven’t seen that. It was a bit disappointing. The lift it gives to the players, and the players’ parents, seeing the first team manager there. That is how the club should be run."

Amorim's lack of support for the academy did not go unnoticed, and fans questioned his faith in young players. Toward the end of Amorim's tenure, he made headlines when he suggested Harry Amass was "struggling" on loan in the Championship and pointed to Chido Obi not starting every U21 game.

When asked whether Kobbie Mainoo could change his manager's mind and earn a starting role, Amorim, without any prompting, said: "[Harry] Amass is now struggling in the Championship. Chido is not always a starter in U21s. All these guys played when a lot of people were saying sack the manager."
Amorim also mentioned Toby Collyer in the press conference, saying: "He’s from the academy, he played here, went to West Bromwich, he’s not playing. He played for Manchester United."

headline: What Sir Jim Ratcliffe said to Michael Carrick in tunnel after Man United's Arsenal win
body: Michael Carrick celebrates after Manchester United's win over Arsenal(Image: (Marc Atkins/Getty Images))

Michael Carrick has revealed Sir Jim Ratcliffe was delighted after Manchester United’s win over Arsenal. Carrick was summoned for talks with Ratcliffe in the Emirates Stadium tunnel after the Reds moved into the top four with a 3-2 victory over the Gunners.

Mikel Arteta’s side took the lead just before the half-hour mark when Lisandro Martinez put the ball through his own net, but Bryan Mbeumo capitalised on a horror backpass by Martin Zubimendi to draw his side level before the break.
Patrick Dorgu then fired United ahead, but Mikel Merino looked to have rescued a valuable point for the Gunners when he bundled the ball home from close-range.

But Matheus Cunha had other ideas, as his stunner three minutes from time secured his side all three points. Following the game, Carrick held talks with Ratcliffe, but when put on the spot about what was discussed, he gave very little away except revealing his boss was a very happy man.
“No, not much as you would expect, I think,” he told Viaplay. “There’s a lot of happy bodies around the camp today and he’s delighted as well. So it was nice to see him.”

Peter Schmeichel then put the United boss on the spot by asking him if he had asked if he could come into his office today, to which a laughing Carrick replied: “No, not yet, Peter. I think it is nice when you can have that feeling with a big win like this, you know, coming away from home.
“Last week was good for different reasons. This one is pretty special. Two good games – it’s about what’s next now and moving forward.”
Reflecting on the win in the capital, Carrick said: "We understood the start of the game was going to be like that, as much as we tried to turn the momentum in our favour.
Michael Carrick following Man United's win over Arsenal
FOLLOW OUR MAN UNITED FACEBOOK PAGE! Latest news and analysis via the MEN’s Manchester United Facebook page

“I think we understood how the game was going to go and the flow of it. I thought we started to take the ball and connections through the pitch, had that composure and a few moments gaining a bit of confidence as well.”

Before he continued: "We were having a decent spell and seemed to be coming into the game when they scored, which was disappointing. Again, we showed the character to come back and there were stages in the game where you have to defend.
“They make you defend the box really and it's challenging at times, but I thought we had enough in the game to keep believing in the confidence and I always fancied us to score.
“The goals were fantastic goals, some of the football was good and we looked dangerous at certain times. There’s other times you have to defend. It was a performance with a bit of everything.”

headline: Sir Jim Ratcliffe's two-word verdict after stunning Manchester United win vs Arsenal
body: Ratcliffe looked delighted.

A beaming Sir Jim Ratcliffe said "yeah, very," when asked whether he was happy after Manchester United's win against Arsenal. Ratcliffe attended the 3-2 win at the Emirates alongside Omar Berrada and Jason Wilcox.
Arsenal equalised through Mikel Merino in the 84th minute, but there was another twist in the game when Matheus Cunha scored three minutes later to secure a huge victory for United.

When Ratcliffe left the stadium, he was asked if he could speak to reporters. "No, no, no," he said before adding, "just get the smile" and gesturing that his lips were sealed. Then the United co-owner was asked whether he was happy with the result, and he responded: "Very, yeah."
FOLLOW OUR MAN UNITED FACEBOOK PAGE! Latest news and analysis via the MEN’s Manchester United Facebook page

Ratcliffe's regime sacked Ruben Amorim amid rising tensions with the board. Darren Fletcher served as caretaker for two games and Michael Carrick was appointed as head coach until the end of the season.
Carrick oversaw a win against Manchester City in his first game in charge and built on that result by securing a stunning victory against Premier League leaders Arsenal, which moved United to fourth.

Speaking to the BBC, Carrick said: "It was a good day. I think we had to put a lot into that game, an awful lot. Credit to the boys, so proud of them. We had to sustain some attacks, especially earlier on and we grew into the game.

"We had a setback, come back strong, had a setback towards the end, come back strong. So many elements to the game that were good. We're so fresh whether it's 10 days in, two games, it's never going to be perfect at this stage, especially coming against a team like Arsenal.
"But there were so many positives to take and we'll keep adding to it in days and weeks to come. The boys have been fantastic in terms of taking things on, wanting to do it and investing into it.

"You can see what it means to them at the end. Really proud of them today, it's obvious to say but it's a tough place to come. Especially with the way the game flowed we stick at it and fantastic feeling at the end."

headline: Manchester United just unleashed three future stars - Chido Obi, JJ Gabriel and Kai Rooney
body: Chido Obi scored against Derby.(Image: Manchester United)
The definition of an embarrassment of riches: more options or resources than one knows what to do with. Darren Fletcher had that when Manchester United played in the FA Youth Cup on Friday night.

It almost felt unfair for JJ Gabriel and Chido Obi to start together against Derby County. They are both special talents who can hold their own against senior professionals, never mind fellow teenagers.

Kai Rooney was on the bench. Wayne Rooney's son is that prolific in front of goal that he scored 56 goals in one season when he was 11. His father was in the stands, sitting alongside Michael Carrick, to watch.

Carrick attended to show further support for the academy after watching the Under-21s in action on Tuesday. Carrick spoke about the importance of the Youth Cup and said that he was "excited" to attend.
FOLLOW OUR MAN UNITED FB PAGE! Latest news and analysis via the MEN’s Manchester United Facebook page

Steve Holland and Jonny Evans were also spotted in the directors' box. Stephen Torpey, head of the academy, is understood to have welcomed the presence of the first-team staff at youth games again. Ruben Amorim did not show a similar interest during his one-and-a-half tenure in Manchester.

Rooney tried to avoid attention when he arrived at Old Trafford, but a hood did not succeed in disguising his identity from a few excited supporters outside the ground, who stopped him for photographs.

It was a big story that Rooney's son was on the bench at Old Trafford, nine years after his final game at the ground. Kai has played as a striker since he was a boy, but his father recently explained that his role has changed, saying: "He's gone to the right wing. Left-footed, coming in off the right side."

The warning signs were there for Derby. Gabriel danced down the left side - his balance is impressive - and played a delightful cross into the box. The 16-year-old was soon down that flank again, cutting inside and getting a shot away, only to be denied by Derby goalkeeper Cristiano Dzialuk.
Gabriel looked dangerous from the start.(Image: Manchester United)
Obi didn't want his younger peer to steal the show and attempted a shot of his own from the edge of the box. A few minutes later, he was denied by the outstretched legs of Dzialuk.
The striker made seven Premier League appearances last season and starred during the post-season tour, but he's exclusively played in academy fixtures because coaches felt he still needs to develop.

It's bound to have been difficult for Obi to drop down after getting a taste of playing in front of a full-capacity Old Trafford, however, anyone who has watched him play for the U21s this season will agree with the decision to move him down, as he still has parts of his game to improve.

Obi's final ball, decision-making and work rate out of possession could be better. Nonetheless, he is a lethal striker at youth level, particularly at U18 level. Obi has rarely played U18 football since his arrival, but United want to win the Youth Cup and his inclusion in the team was a signal of intent from Darren Fletcher.

Fletcher has returned to manage the U18s after briefly serving as caretaker. The 41-year-old was offered a role in Carrick's backroom staff, but felt it was the best choice for his career to return to the U18s.

Fletcher was just as enthusiastic as he was in games against Burnley in the Premier League and Brighton in the FA Cup, shouting instructions to Gabriel and reminding Bendito Mantato of his defensive duties. "Bendi, come on!" Fletcher screamed when Derby made a promising counter-attack.
Mantato had a great game against Derby.(Image: Manchester United)
The word before the game was that Derby needed to be respected and that proved to be the case. Despite the talent on the pitch for United, the away side looked capable of landing a blow.

United goalkeeper Cameron Bryne-Hughes became busier as the match progressed. Fletcher grew increasingly agitated on the touchline. The game wasn't going according to the script, which was perfectly summed up by Gabriel and Obi getting in each other's way around Derby's box.

There was audible anticipation in the stands when Gabriel was sent over the top with 10 minutes remaining, but Derby captain Rio Canoville recovered brilliantly to thwart the danger. Then Mantato, the standout performer in a red shirt, missed a huge chance with seconds of normal time remaining.

Fletcher may have said to continue to 'huff and puff and blow their house down' when he prepared his team for extra-time. James Overy and Kai Rooney were introduced from the bench. Overy had an immediate impact by playing a cross into the box that led to the dreadlock being broken in the 101st minute.
A demoralised Derby conceded again two minutes later, their resolve finally giving way. Obi scored the goal he'd been desperate for, and celebrated with a knee slide in front of the 2,000 fans.

There were chants of 'Rooney, Rooney' when Kai Rooney was brought on from the bench. Derby set up a nervy end to the game by scoring to make it 2-1 late in extra-time, but it was ultimately United's strength in depth, their embarrassment of riches, that proved to be the difference on the night.

headline: Michael Carrick opens up about Manchester United conversation with Ole Gunnar Solskjaer
body: Solskjaer and Carrick contended for the interim job this season.(Image: 2021 Alex Livesey - Danehouse)

Michael Carrick has revealed that he has spoken to Ole Gunnar Solskjaer since beating him to the Manchester United interim job. Carrick, Solskjaer and Ruud van Nistelrooy were considered to take charge of United for the remainder of the campaign, but Carrick landed the role.
United sources described Carrick as 'impressive' throughout the interview process, and he made a dream start to his interim role by overseeing a stunning victory against Manchester City last weekend.
Solskjaer has been out of work since being sacked by Besiktas in August. The Norwegian was responsible for Besiktas crashing out of Europe and was axed after just seven months in charge.
FOLLOW OUR MAN UNITED FACEBOOK PAGE! Latest news and analysis via the MEN’s Manchester United Facebook page

Carrick got a first taste of coaching as part of Jose Mourinho's backroom staff and he was retained when Solskjaer took over. Carrick has remained in touch with Solskjaer since working with him during that spell.

When asked whether he'd spoken to Solskjaer, Carrick said: "Yeah, I spoke to him. I'm close, we've been through a lot together, so he's been fully supportive and as you'd expect. He's some man and I respect him an awful lot. He wished us all the best and he was happy that we got the right result."

Discussing whether he would pick Solskjaer's brains, he responded: "I think friendships, you have conversations, I've got a lot of friends in places that I can kind of pick on if I need to be. I'm not one who bothers a lot of people, to be honest. But he's certainly there if ever I need him."

Carrick served as United caretaker after Solskjaer was sacked in November 2021. He left the position with an undefeated record, which included a 3-2 victory against Arsenal, but he does not believe that previous encounter against Mikel Arteta is relevant ahead of this weekend's clash against the Gunners.
Carrick after beating Arsenal in November 2021.(Image: 2021 Manchester United FC)

"I'll be honest with you, I think the confidence I'm taking going into the game is what we've seen since I've been here between me and my staff in terms of the game itself, training, how the boys have gone about it. Games from three or four years ago. It's done. It's in the past," he said.
"So as much as the experience kind of helps you in certain moments, I think it's a totally different game on Sunday and two teams going into it, looking forward to it in good shape."
Speaking about United's game plan at the Emirates on Sunday, Carrick said: "I think it's just playing to what we feel the game needs, really.

"It's never the same. Even if you come in half time and you've had a good performance for 45 minutes, I'm never one that likes to say same again because it's never, ever the same again. You've got to build on it. So it won't be kind of copy and paste.
"I think there's new elements that need to come into it. We need to be ready, we need to be at our best. And if we are our best and we're there, we feel we've got a good chance."
